technology.short_description: It can't be ignored - Tilea is the land of art, wealth and continuous warfare. Tilean mercenaries are highly valued for reasons beyond their funny accent.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Pikemen and Pavise Crossbowmen units
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Mercenary Captains

technology.short_description: Mercenaries know how to make their risky lives a little bit more sustainable. Surely not for the others.
A soldier that has faced many a defeat is less likely to just run away at the first sign of trouble.

effects.description: Leadership: +1 per experience rank for all units

technology.short_description: PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER
PLACEHOLDER
As regiments gain renown, their standards become talismans that are just as important as their sword-arms.
State Troops are often issued with armour plate to ensure unit cohesion and a reasonable level of protection.
Thicker plates for riders and scaled barding for their mounts, meaning a greater percentage survive to charge again.
"See the scruffy one with the bandage and the limp? Pick that one. Just do it."
"You think that's scary? Wake me up when it starts spitting fire all over the pl-Alright, alright, bloody Myrmidia, I'm coming."

effects.description: Passive ability: "Discombobulate" for Adventurers, Carabiniers and Carlsson Militia units
Melee defence: +3 for Adventurers, Carabiniers and Carlsson Militia units

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: More barrels, more chances to knock enemy blocks clean off – it's simply a matter of arithmetic.
Industrialised production of ammunition for handguns has allowed the Empire to hoard large supplies.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders missile units

technology.short_description: Fixing arms atop mounts and rides does away with the need to dismount and set up prior to firing, in turn reducing vulnerability and increasing efficiency.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% for Pistoliers and Outriders units
Missile strength: +10% for Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: Refined ore techniques create stronger steel, making for more durable blades and heavier weapon-heads.

effects.description: Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Halberdier units

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

technology.short_description: Although the cost falls to each individual soldier, it is expected that all will use standardised equipment.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for melee infantry units
Charge bonus: +8% for melee infantry units

technology.short_description: What a mount cannot see will not spook them, ensuring every charge hits the target squarely.
When you are the one holding the lit candle for the surgeon to amputate your own leg, you got your troops full respect until the day you die.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

technology.short_description: Inspired by the fabled might of Tylos, by the elven legacy and driven by the pent-up potential in the wealthy Tilea of nowadays, one might think of ways to overcome the usual tilean rivalry for something greater...
Even the largest hulking war machine can be made more resilient to attack.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 8% for Steam Tank and War Wagon units

technology.short_description: Missile units who train together excel at firing a deadly hail, so not all members of a regiment have to see the target.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +15% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders units

technology.short_description: The discovery of barrel-rifling led to increases in speed and accuracy. Both Dwarfs and men claim credit for this invention.

effects.description: Missile strength: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers and Handgunners units

technology.short_description: Kislev
There's always a new market to be tapped, or a fresh approach to existing ones.
"See here, we have to form up the troops into curved arrows and drive them deep into the enemy oblongs. What? Diagrams are clear."
By the union of impenetrable pike formations, daring cavalry actions and, of course, substantial economical support, Tilean warfare can reign supreme.

effects.description: Base Weapon damage: +3 for Duellists, Pikemen, Republican Guard and cavalry units

technology.short_description: "Nothing but tha best armour here-a! Quarrel tested! Money back guaranteed if it breaks!"

effects.description: Armour: +10 for all heavy armour units

technology.short_description: "See here, we have to form up the troops into curved arrows and drive them deep into the enemy oblongs. What? Diagrams are clear."
In a heterogeneous mercenary army, coordination is key to victory. And a well-cooperating host is like an unstoppable grinder.
The greatest minds of the Old World are gathered by the Empire’s various institutions to impart their knowledge and methods of efficiency.

effects.description: Income from Iron, Gem and Gold Mines: +15%

technology.short_description: The Imperial Architects are an eccentric bunch who have always had, well, let's say 'fanciful' ideas about how a building should look…
A rebate is a useful tool when things are good to ensure compliance during the hard times inevitably just around the corner.
It's comforting for people to know where their next meal will come from when winter's chill descends.
By the union of impenetrable pike formations, daring cavalry actions and, of course, substantial economical support, Tilean warfare can reign supreme.

effects.description: Base Weapon damage: +3 for Duellists, Pikemen, Republican Guard and cavalry units

technology.short_description: "Nothing but tha best armour here-a! Quarrel tested! Money back guaranteed if it breaks!"

effects.description: Armour: +10 for all heavy armour units

technology.short_description: "See here, we have to form up the troops into curved arrows and drive them deep into the enemy oblongs. What? Diagrams are clear."
In a heterogeneous mercenary army, coordination is key to victory. And a well-cooperating host is like an unstoppable grinder.
The bravest, most-accomplished warriors do not always come from among the nobility, but must get their start somewhere.
The wealth of the Southern Realms flows through sea and land, into chests and pockets, and back again.

effects.description: Melee attack and Melee defence: +4 for Duellists and Montante Swordsmen

technology.short_description: Actual war is only the last resort in the art of diplomacy, and leverage is just another kind of artillery.
The Cult of Myrmidia abhors Chaos in all its forms, and when it draws near, the Order of the Eagle must take arms.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +20% for Priestesses, High Eagles and Myrmidian units

technology.short_description: "Keep 'em payments to the little buggers regular and they won't raze your city to the ground because you filed a couple of coins. Oh, Master Dwarf, what a lovely surprise!"

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for all heavy armour units
Missile strength: +10% for crossbow, gunpowder and artillery units

technology.short_description: A more efficient way of transferring force from gas under pressure speeds up the production process, meaning more steam-powered weapons ready for the fight.

effects.description: Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Steam Tank, War Wagon and Luminark of Hysh units

technology.short_description: Intelligence shared is intelligence doubled.
The New World is a shrine of dangers and secrets, expensive ones. The most common trinket a bait to destruction or an unthinkable tool of power.
The wealth of the Southern Realms flows through sea and land, into chests and pockets, and back again.

effects.description: Melee attack and Melee defence: +4 for Duellists and Montante Swordsmen

technology.short_description: Actual war is only the last resort in the art of diplomacy, and leverage is just another kind of artillery.
The Cult of Myrmidia abhors Chaos in all its forms, and when it draws near, the Order of the Eagle must take arms.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +20% for Priestesses, High Eagles and Myrmidian units

technology.short_description: Inspired by the fabled might of Tylos, by the elven legacy and driven by the pent-up potential in the wealthy Tilea of nowadays, one might think of ways to overcome the usual tilean rivalry for something greater...

technology.onscreen_name: Emissary to the Prince of Altdorf
technology.short_description: This trusted advisor, whose loyalty is beyond reproach, knows the Emperor's mind almost as well as Karl Franz himself!

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Empire, Kislev and Southern Realms

technology.short_description: Successful dealings with the lofty, aloof Asur takes a certain type of individual if awkward diplomatic misunderstandings are to be avoided.
The wealth of the Southern Realms flows through sea and land, into chests and pockets, and back again.

effects.description: Melee attack and Melee defence: +4 for Duellists and Montante Swordsmen

technology.short_description: Actual war is only the last resort in the art of diplomacy, and leverage is just another kind of artillery.
The Cult of Myrmidia abhors Chaos in all its forms, and when it draws near, the Order of the Eagle must take arms.

effects.description: Missile block chance: +20% for Priestesses, High Eagles and Myrmidian units

technology.short_description: "Keep 'em payments to the little buggers regular and they won't raze your city to the ground because you filed a couple of coins. Oh, Master Dwarf, what a lovely surprise!"

effects.description: Recruitment cost: -10% for all heavy armour units
Missile strength: +10% for crossbow, gunpowder and artillery units

technology.short_description: Foul Greenskins, flea-infested Skaven, gluttonous Ogres and slimy Lizardmen are abroad in sufficient numbers that an organised cull is now necessary.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen
Melee defence: +5 when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Ogres and Lizardmen

technology.short_description: There may be fell Necromancy afoot, for the Undead and Unliving infest Imperial territory in too greater numbers, hastening the need for an immediate purge.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: These lands belong to the Empire – those arrogant, knife-eared Elves must be driven back to their own dominion, and with haste!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% when fighting against Elves

technology.short_description: The taint of Chaos has been observed here; such things must not be allowed to gain a foothold and be removed without delay!

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +5% for all units when fighting against Norsca, Warriors of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Daemons of Chaos and Beastmen

technology.short_description: If one could stack Leonardo da Miragliano's sketches in a pile, they'd probably reach Morrslieb. Upstart polymath Ugoletti has expressed interest in trying to make sense in one of these, so far kept secret. A wooden vehicle of bizarre shape, but the crank design looks all wrong...
The prototype seems to be somewhat working after bypassing Leonardo's puzzles, but Ugoletti needs more funding to improve the construction process and design. Your treasurers are murmuring.

Ugoletti claims that he can perfect the design, if only he could get his hands on an efficient power source; however, his sauce-splattered notes are exceedingly nebulous and he seems to be falling prey to hyperactive paranoia. If only one would fund an expedition to the jungles, for one of those things he calls Solar Engines...

effects.description: Missile strength and reload: +10% for Tortoise Tanks

Unlocked in the Renown pool:
	 Ugoletti's Floating Ordnance (Tortoise Tank)

technology.short_description: If one could stack Leonardo da Miragliano's sketches in a pile, they'd probably reach Morrslieb. Upstart polymath Ugoletti has expressed interest in trying to make sense in one of these, so far kept secret. A wooden vehicle of bizarre shape, but the crank design looks all wrong...
The prototype seems to be somewhat working after bypassing Leonardo's puzzles, but Ugoletti needs more funding to improve the construction process and design. Your treasurers are murmuring.

Ugoletti claims that he can perfect the design, if only he could get his hands on an efficient power source; however, his sauce-splattered notes are exceedingly nebulous and he seems to be falling prey to hyperactive paranoia. If only one would fund an expedition to the jungles, for one of those things he calls Solar Engines...

effects.description: Missile strength and reload: +10% for Tortoise Tanks

technology.short_description: A powerful, authoritative voice in any Hold, the Guilds dominate Dwarfen civil life, controlling trade, finances and labour.
